content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
using Printf

function join_string(string::Vector{<:String}, ndims=1)
    join(string, " ")
end


join_string(["a", "bc", "defg", "hi", "j", "k", "l"])

function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    text_split = split(text, " ")
    lines = []
    line = []
    width = 0
    for word in text_split
        if width > 0
            width += 1  #space
        end
        new_width = width + length(word)
        if new_width > text_width
            lines = vcat(lines, line)
            line = [word]
            width = length(word)
        else
            push!(line, word)
            width = new_width
        end
    end
    lines = vcat(lines, line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end

wrap_string("a bc defg hi j k l", 10)
```
